Constructor Detail

MathUtil

public MathUtil()
Method Detail

computeHyperPeriod

public static long computeHyperPeriod(long a,
                                      long b)
Computes the hyperperiod of two periods. If either of the periods is 0, then the hyperperiod equals the other period. If both periods are >0, then the hyperperiod equals the LCM of a and b

Parameters:
a - the first period.
b - the second period.
Returns:
the hyperperiod of a and b.

computeVHyperPeriod

public static double computeVHyperPeriod(long a,
                                         double dya,
                                         long b,
                                         double dyb)
Computes the maximum offset on the y-axis for a curve part of length hyperPeriod(a,b) with periodic offsets of dya or dyb respectively. I.e. if both periods a and b are 0, then the offset is 0. If either of the period is 0, then the maximum offset equals the offset belonging to the other period. Otherwise, the maximum offset is computed as offset = max((HP/a)*dya, (HP/b)*dyb) .

Parameters:
a - the first period.
dya - the y-offset of the first period.
b - the second period.
dyb - the y-offset of the second period.
Returns:
the hyperperiod of a and b.

gcd

                       long b)
Computes the GCD of two numbers.

Parameters:
a - the first number.
b - the second number.
Returns:
the GCD of a and b.

                       long b)

the LCM of a and b.

round

public static double round(double number)
Rounds number to the precision that was set using setRoundPrecision(). If this precision is not set, a default precision is used.

Parameters:
number - the number to round.
Returns:
number rounded number.

setRoundPrecision

public static void setRoundPrecision(int d)
Sets the precision for the round() method. Numbers passed to round() will be round to d digits after the comma. If d is negative, numbers passed to round() will be rounded to d powers of 10.

Parameters:
d - the precision for round().

getRoundPrecision

public static int getRoundPrecision()
Returns the precision of the round() method.

Returns:
the precision of the round() method.

isFullNumber

public static boolean isFullNumber(double number)
Returns true if number is a natural number.

Returns:
true if number is a natural number.
